Review Title: Minimalistic hotel for a very decent price. Very convenient location, but very simplified service
Negative Reviews:
I was very tired when arriving at the hotel around midnight a Saturday night, after travelling from central Europe. I was taking the tram (Bybanen) directly from the airport, and it became really packed with young people as we got closer to the city center. This has nothing to do with the hotel - but I will NEVER again take the tram to the city on a late saturday eve.
My main point is about the digitalization at this hotel. I think it is a failure, and shows that digitalization might go wrong.
Arriving at the hotel and checking in was NOT easy. The door was closed, and there was a sign that I should use the doorbell behind me. I did, and a young lady came promptly and let me in. My first thougt was, if there is staff present around the clock - why not staff a reseption desk?
The self-service check-in computer was impossible to miss. I had my code ready, and started the registration. It all went fast, but my room number was displayed in 3 seconds, than disappeard and the check-in computer spitted out a card with no room number, I could read a message that a welcome email was sent to me. I was so tired that I did not notice the room number. I cheked my inbox, but no email had arrived. I waited a minute, and checked again - still no email. 
I went around the corner, and found an office with two persons from the hotel staff. They were very friendly, and solved my problem in few seconds, handing me a paper with the room number.
So I asked myself again - why not have a reception desk, where a friendly human being receives you, give you a smile, and help you to check-in and give you a key and the room number. This approach has been used in hotels for hundreds of years, and there is NO NEED to change that, when you are paying staff to be present anyway.
I moved up to my room, which was quiet, clean, modern and new. But it was very simple - no wardrobe or shelfs, but just naked walls. No TV (!), and a very small bathroom. 
"What you pay is what you get".
Positive Reviews: The hotel is located not in, but close to the city center. Only 2 minutes walk from the tram ("Bybanen"), 3-4 stops from the Bergen city center.  Even if it was close to the busy traffic junction Danmarksplass, the room was surprisingly quiet, and made it possible to have a good nights sleep!
